title: A1278 820-2936-A no power
message:
Hi,

I have an A1278 820-2936-A very strange.

Client reports that it started to become vey slow in macos,  until it stoped working.

If If pressure the power button once, the fan spin1 turn and turns off. When trigerring SMC_ONOFF_L, it has the same behavier.

However, if if keep pressuring the power button or trigering the SMC_ONOFF_L for 2 or 3 seconds, the mac turns on and i have display (board alone on bench).

Can you help?

title: A1278 820-2936-A no power
message: Check how SMC_ONOFF_L reacts, disconnecting keyboard first.

title: A1278 820-2936-A no power
message:
Hi,

It has the same behavier full assembled, w/o the keyboard connected.

title: A1278 820-2936-A no power
message:
Run corresponding ASD.

Battery is charging?
SMC_ONOFF_L steady 3.3V (in normal mode)?

Check U5010 outputs.

title: A1278 820-2936-A no power
message:
Hi,

Battery is charging and  SMC_ONOFF_L is 3.454V steady.

U5010:
SMC_MANUAL_RST_L = 2.8V
SMC_RESET_L = 3.424V
PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC = 3.3V

title: A1278 820-2936-A no power
message:
Run corresponding ASD; lets see if any error pops up.
Fan spins normally?

title: A1278 820-2936-A no power
message:
HI,
ASD didn't found any problem, and FAN spins normaly, when it boots. When it doesn't boot, the FAN starts to spin imidiatly when power buttun is presured, and then stops.

title: A1278 820-2936-A no power
message:
Run HWMonitor and check all current/voltage sensors reported.
See if any value is strange.

title: A1278 820-2936-A no power
message:
Hi,
I've instaled a new macOS, but i can't see nothing strange in HWMonitor.
Any idea?

title: A1278 820-2936-A no power
message: Is the machine working good, or slow?
